meanings.definition: Attempting to sell something or promote something aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The touting salesman tried to convince everyone to buy his product.
meanings.sent2: She received a touting flyer in the mail advertising a big sale.
meanings.sent3: The touting vendor was so persistent that he even tried to sell ice to an Eskimo.
meanings.sent4: The touting marketing campaign was like a loud trumpet announcing the new product.
meanings.sent5: The image of the touting car salesman stayed in my mind long after I left the dealership.

meanings.sent1: Her touting comments about my outfit were not appreciated.
meanings.sent2: He always had a touting opinion on how to fix everything.
meanings.sent3: The touting neighbor couldn't resist giving tips on gardening, even though no one asked.
meanings.sent4: His touting suggestions were like arrows shot randomly in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her touting guidance lingered in my thoughts for days.

meanings.sent1: The company was touting their services to anyone who passed by.
meanings.sent2: He was touting his skills to potential employers at the job fair.
meanings.sent3: The street performer was touting for an audience to watch his show.
meanings.sent4: The politician was touting for votes in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent5: The store was touting its new products with colorful banners and signs.
